# glassy-console

Console commands for the glassy framework

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     glassy-console:
       github: glassy-framework/glassy-console
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

We recommend using with the DI container, available in [glassy-kernel](https://github.com/glassy-framework/glassy-kernel).

Add the Console Bundle to your DI container:

```crystal
require "glassy-kernel"
require "glassy-console"
require "./commands/my_command"

class AppKernel < Glassy::Kernel::Kernel
  register_bundles [
    Glassy::Console::Bundle,
    MyAppBundle
  ]
end
```

Create your command:

```crystal
require "glassy-console"

class MyCommand < Glassy::Console::Command
  property name : String = "my:command"
  property description : String = "my description"

  @[Argument(name: "name", desc: "Name of the person")]
  @[Option(name: "fill", desc: "Fill or not?")]
  def execute(name : String, fill : Bool)
    output.writeln("name = #{name}")
    output.writeln("fill = #{fill}")
  end
end
```

Add to your service file (services.yml)

```yml
services:
  my_command:
    class: MyCommand
    kwargs:
      input: '@console_input'
      output: '@console_output'
    tag:
      - command
```

Now you can run setup your console application: 

```crystal
kernel = AppKernel.new
kernel.container.console_app.run(ARGV)
```

## Development

Always run crystal spec before submiting code

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/glassy-framework/glassy-console/fork>)

5. Create a new Pull Request

def.name: display_main_screen
def.body:
output.writeln(@name)
output.writeln
output.writeln("Usage:", :yellow)
output.writeln("  command [options] [arguments]")
output.writeln
output.writeln("Options:", :yellow)
output.display_two_columns([{"--help", "display help"}])
output.writeln
output.writeln("Available commands:", :yellow)
commands_by_prefix = make_commands_by_prefix
prefixes = commands_by_prefix.keys.sort
prefixes.each do |prefix|
  if prefix != ""
    output.writeln(" #{prefix}", :yellow)
  end
  commands = commands_by_prefix[prefix]
  columns = commands.sort_by do |c|
    c.name
  end.map do |command|
    {command.name, command.description}
  end
  output.display_two_columns(columns)
end

def.name: find_command
def.body:
@commands.each do |cmd|
  if cmd.name == cmd_name
    return cmd
  end
end
return nil

def.name: make_commands_by_prefix
def.body:
group = Hash(String, Array(Command)).new
@commands.each do |command|
  name_pieces = command.name.split(":")
  prefix = name_pieces.size > 1 ? name_pieces[0] : ""
  if group.has_key?(prefix)
  else
    group[prefix] = [] of Command
  end
  group[prefix] << command
end
group

def.name: run
def.body:
parser = ArgumentParser.new(argv, ["help"])
arguments = parser.get_arguments
cmd_name = arguments.shift?
if cmd_name
  cmd = find_command(cmd_name)
  if cmd.nil?
    output.error("Command not found: #{cmd_name}")
  else
    if parser.get_bool_option("help")
      cmd.describe
    else
      run_command(cmd, argv)
    end
  end
else
  validator = ArgumentValidator.new({"help" => {ArgumentValidator::ArgType::Option, false}})
  if validator.validate(parser)
    display_main_screen
  else
    @output.error(validator.error_message.not_nil!)
  end
end

def.name: run_command
def.body:
new_argv = [] of String
cmd_name_removed = false
argv.each do |arg|
  if (arg == cmd.name) && (!cmd_name_removed)
    cmd_name_removed = true
  else
    new_argv << arg
  end
end
cmd.execute_arguments(new_argv)

def.name: get_arguments
def.body:
last_arg = ""
@args.reject do |arg|
  return_value = (is_option(arg)) || (is_option_value(arg, last_arg))
  last_arg = arg
  return_value
end.map do |arg|
  parse_value(arg)
end

def.name: get_option
def.body:
return_next_arg = false
@args.each do |arg|
  if return_next_arg
    return parse_value(arg)
  end
  if (is_option(arg)) && (cmp_option(name, arg))
    if is_boolean_option(arg)
      return "1"
    else
      pieces = arg.split("=")
      if pieces.size > 1
        first_piece = pieces.shift
        return parse_value(pieces.join("="))
      else
        return_next_arg = true
      end
    end
  end
end
return nil

def.name: get_option_names
def.body:
@args.select do |arg|
  is_option(arg)
end.map do |arg|
  get_real_option_name(arg)
end

def.name: is_boolean_option
def.body:
if !(is_option(name))
  return false
end
real_name = get_real_option_name(name)
if @bool_args_names.map do |n|
  get_real_option_name(n)
end.includes?(real_name)
  return true
end
return false

def.name: is_option_value
def.body:
if (is_option(last_name)) && (!(is_boolean_option(last_name)))
  return true
end
return false

def.name: get_argument_names
def.body:
names = [] of String
@rules.each do |name, rule|
  if rule[0] == ArgType::Argument
    names << name
  end
end
names

def.name: has_option?
def.body:
if @rules.has_key?(name)
else
  return false
end
rule = @rules[name]
return rule[0] == ArgType::Option

def.name: validate
def.body:
@error_message = nil
argument_names = get_argument_names
if parser.get_arguments.size > argument_names.size
  message = "Too many arguments"
  if argument_names.size > 0
    expected = argument_names.map do |n|
      "\"#{n}\""
    end.join(", ")
    message = message + ", expected arguments #{expected}"
  end
  @error_message = message
  return false
end
arguments = parser.get_arguments
idx = 0
get_arg_rules.each do |name, rule|
  value = arguments[idx]?
  if rule[1] && (value.nil? || (value.size == 0))
    @error_message = "The argument #{name} is required"
    return false
  end
  idx = idx + 1
end
parser.get_option_names.each do |opt_name|
  if has_option?(opt_name)
  else
    @error_message = "The option --#{opt_name} does not exists"
    return false
  end
end
@rules.each do |opt_name, rule|
  if (ArgType::Option == rule[0]) && rule[1]
    value = parser.get_option(opt_name)
    if (!(parser.is_boolean_option(opt_name))) && (value.nil? || (value.size == 0))
      @error_message = "The option --#{opt_name} is required"
      return false
    end
  end
end
return true

instance_methods.args_string: (text, fore : Symbol, back : Symbol? = nil) : String

def.name: describe
def.body:
output.writeln("Description:", :yellow)
output.writeln("  #{description}")
output.writeln
args_text = get_metadata.select do |item|
  item["type"] == "argument"
end.map do |item|
  "<#{item["name"]}>"
end.join(" ")
output.writeln("Usage:", :yellow)
output.writeln("  #{name} [options] #{args_text}")
output.writeln
option_texts = [{"--help", "Display this help message"}]
get_metadata.each do |item|
  if item["type"] == "option"
    arg_name = "--#{item["name"]}"
    if item["boolean"] == "0"
      arg_name = arg_name + "=VALUE"
    end
    option_texts << {arg_name, item["description"]}
  end
end
output.writeln("Options:", :yellow)
output.display_two_columns(option_texts)

instance_methods.name: colorize
instance_methods.args_string: (text, fore : Symbol, back : Symbol? = nil) : String

def.name: colorize
def.body:
result = text.colorize.fore(fore)
if back
  result.back(back)
end
result.to_s

def.name: display_two_columns
def.body:
first_size = items.reduce(0) do |max, item|
  item[0].size > max ? item[0].size : max
end
items.each do |item|
  write("  #{item[0].ljust(first_size)}", :green)
  writeln("  #{item[1]}")
end
